author: Lovenia Williams
comment: Love the functionality. I've been disappointed today after using the app and the images of the artist aren't correct. Not sure why but it's very disappointing and I will be looking forward to seeing the actual artists image portrayed with the song. SN: totally agree with RioVentura. I miss having the blue button there. The convienence of having the button there to tap was nice.

author: Something Amiss
comment: I used to use shazam years ago and it was perfect. It could find a song over noise and even when the song was low volume. It didn't take too long to get a recording and have the song you want to know. But now it doesn't seem to work. It only recognises the most popular songs and even then you have to try a few times. But what's the point of it if everyone and their grandma already know the only songs this app seems to recognise?  I wanted this app to be able to recognise the songs I don't know on the radio and on TV shows but most times it won't work or by the time it would, the song would be over and gone. This is incredibly sad as I know for a fact that shazam used to be so much better than this. Please fix this

author: Aaron Gunnz
comment: I haven't yet identified a single track since downloading it. Sony recommends it highly but it is not replacement of Sony's track ID. U got to improve it, it is must to find it in radio so that I trace music directly from my phone's radio 📻 thru 🎧. It shouldn't be limited a speaker 🔊 of radio and TV but it must thru headphones too just like the track id of Sony did. Thanks and I hope that u will improve just like I requested 😉

author: dylan stollberg
comment: Loving the updats, this app is great and so easy to use  Having it linked to spotify so i can add songs directly to my playlists without even going into the spotify app is awesome!   Also Finds 99% of songs, its great.  I dont usually leave reviews but thought this app deserves one.  Good job!

author: Shane Elliott
comment: When I first tried Shazam years ago, it was fantastic. It could tell me a song playing over the noise of a restaurant & cafe. These days, I'd say 1/10 songs are recognized. I can find it faster using Google and a line of lyrics.

author: Meaghan Flynn
comment: Of course it's a great app, but I really wish that they would show the year that the song you looked up was released. I'm always wondering, and it's frustrating that it's not there. Also it should show the album that the song was from.

author: Danil Chemeris
comment: Why is the widget button so massive? Should be 1x1 not 2x2. Also hardly recognises anything these days, really sucks. How can you ruin an app so badly?

author: Angie Foster
comment: The best thing about shazaam was that the lyrics would come up. I don't know what you did, but the layout is different (Which is fine), but lyrics are non existent. What exactly is your purpose, if not to give ALL the info one is expecting when they "shazaam"? Like "Shazaam!" It's there! More like "sha-meh"😐 there's other lyric sights, I guess.

author: Sparky Kitty
comment: Why does this app suck at finding songs prior to what I want to find? I literally can't find the name of the songs at all. I can't even find any EDM song that is remixed, and you call this app best at finding songs. Not really the best if I do say so myself.

author: Mike Hoyes
comment: Shazam is just a device to make us part with more of our money into the android way of doing business. You Shazam but you can't play the songs unless you pay into Spotify or buy the tracks via Google. It's easier to go home from a night out look at the list of songs you have in here and search them in youTube for free. Shazam is just a listening device with a built in tracker that's linked to Spotify.I don't believe in paying to listen on my mobile. We pay extortionate prices for phone usage to start with. I buy quality phones online. I don't get trapped by over inflated contracts.

author: Lola Arta
comment: Can't recognise clear mainstream song. Disaster. What are you doing with this app??? SoundHound is not good solution anymore either. Do something good for a change. This is pitiful

author: i am empty
comment: I just got this app so i could know a song that i really like, guess what. The app FORCES you to make an account so you can see the song. And the end, the song got lost so i couldnt see it. Just, no.
This app has NEVER failed me. No matter how old/new/genre, I love that at the touch of a button, I get title/info of a song I'm hearing but can't think of name of/artist. Thx Shazam!! :)

author: Lucijan Luka Hančić
comment: Your Auto-Shazam feature is TERRIBLE!!! Doesn't recognize songs in a mix, let alone songs that play on the radio.... For instance, out of 15 songs, the auto feature recognizes just one song. JUST ONE? Not a troll, just being honest.

Shazam used to work well with videos of YouTube now it sends me straight to Google play which doesn't even work. Videos doesn't even load like it should. If I wanted to listen on Google play I'd open that app first but seems like yourl lost the plot

author: Lorena Terry
comment: I hope you fix this issue of the Shazam app not opening, nor the Shazam widget working. I really like this app, it's usually very helpful, but right now it has a crash bug, where it doesn't open. Could you please fix that?

Used to be essential for identifying songs...now slow and very hit and miss. Nothing to do with Apple's acquisition of Shazam perchance ? Blithely informed me that an Inspiral Carpets track was Mozart's Piano Concerto No. 23 in A Minor. Mindbogglingly hopeless !

author: Marius Carter
comment: App isn't responding. By the time it decides to work, the song you try to find its name, it'd be long gone. All my other apps are running fine but this one takes ages to load, very unresponsive and freezes alot.

author: Alex Mavrakanas
comment: Lately it's been too bloated to function, does not tag songs correctly on the first try and can't pick up tunes in noisy background. Used to work a lot better a couple of years ago...

author: Rio Ventura
comment: Whilst I appreciate the artistic appeal of a recognition screen that morphs into an artist splash page, who was this Graphic Design Major developer that somehow has no idea about the day-to-day functionality of this app and got rid of the blue 's' icon that allows you to Shazam the next song without pressing the back button first to reinitiate the app screen?? Utter update fail.

author: Jose Diaz
comment: Beat Shazam? Yeah, many others can do that now. The old shazam, the one that worked fine a few months ago, was fast and gave you more info like the year a song was released. Now, the new UI is confusing and doesn't provide much information. Also, it got sooo sloooow recognizing a song to the point that it times out on a clearly sounded song, and it now won't let me interrupt the recording, so it's more prone to interference, affecting even more the search. It's unbearable. I'm considering going back to soundhound.

author: Michael Salva
comment: Update is horrible.  The lyrics page was my favorite and now it forces you to do this karoake style scrolling.

author: Filzah J
comment: this app was good when i downloaded it the first few times . it could detect songs in a crowded place & it could detect songs fast . but now , it takes quite a while to detect songs especially on auto-shazam . and another problem is that , why cant it detect quite a number of malay songs now ? it used to be able to detect malay songs easily but now all it says is " no results "

author: Mishqa Abdul
comment: It is super cool, any song you need it gets, but the thing is, that they don't have all the lyrics. So are not the actual lyrics and some are missing, so I give it a 3 and a half out of 5

author: Adi Dragomir
comment: New interface sux big time. Used to be simple, just scroll and you had all the info. The tab for a non technical android app is always a bad idea.

author: ARCHI
comment: 2 year ago this app is wonderful.but now...I have music in phone.but he dont open my song in Play music...what a f..k? now he open music in apple music.and apple music want money for try the apple music.its discastic.therreble app right now.apple you killing wonderfull app..

author: Miltiadis Angelopoulos
comment: I tried to find three very popular songs with this app, got close to the TV and there was no noise around, and it still wouldn't identify any. Tragic. It used to be so much better than this.

author: Justin Carter
comment: I have used shazam for over a year and have loved it. But the new update on android doesnt support apple music, only spotify (which I dont use). Has anybody else noticed this of is there something that I'm missing?

author: mosotho motaung
comment: Out of my busy schedule i decided to take time to review this app, i wish i can give it 0, it used to be one of the best but now is very bad. I shazam a song but is only vibrate and dont show the results.

author: Gareth Morris
comment: Used to be brilliant, could use it to find out what song was being played in places with a lot of background noise. Now you basically need to hold it up to the speakers and tell everyone within a 100m radius to "shut up" - and even then you'll probably get 3x "no result". How the mighty has fallen.....

author: Kevin Cruz
comment: I switched back to Shazam because Google Assistant requires you use Google Music in order for it to work. And since Google can't seem to stop doing things that force users into their own inferior services instead of leaving things that work alone because they previously used mature open source solutions, the only reasonable approach to finding a permanent solution is to stop using google apps and deprive them of revenue until such time that they reverse policies. Spotify, Pandora and iTunes are all vastly superior services and Shazam is superior to GA for not using the Google Music platform.

author: Anne Mariel Ocampo
comment: I listen to videogame music so it's hard for me to know the title of the song being played but this app helped me. Love it!

author: Jana Panoch
comment: I'm happy.. I have identified some instrumentals I've been trying to I.D. for a couple years now.. Rather obscure.. One was "Music for Cats!"

author: Stevan Rus
comment: After apple bought the best app Shazam became the worst! It can not recognize more and more songs at all! Total disappointment!

author: Daniel Duque
comment: I had a Shazam account with my phone number, but the update deleted that and now it is forcing he to sign up with my gmail account which means I lost all my list

author: H Harms
comment: Seems to have lost functionality.  There used to be a button to open songs in Amazon Unlimited.  I would prefer to use Shazam, but will switch to Alexa.

author: GG Sans
comment: I swear this thing is SO damn accurate (with the exception of a few songs) honestly, I can't even imagine how much work was put into this, I was able to find that one song that I was looking for in like, FOREVER,  keep up the good work.

author: Brave Traveler
comment: Just like everything that apple touches, it becomes useless. Not gonna waste my time here. Adios  Shazam!

author: Maddison Silver
comment: Absolutely terrible app! Why is this recommended??? It just keeps giving me "No result" ON EVERYTHING!!!!! I HATE IT!!!!! I CAN NEVER FIND THE MUSIC I'M LOOKING FOR!!!!! 😠😠😠😠😠😠😠😠😠😠😠😠👎👎👎👎

author: David Kunkel
comment: This update breaks the lyrics functionality of Shazam in some pretty horrible ways. In the previous version, if there were no lyrics available in Shazam you used to be able to click on it to find lyrics on the web. That functionality is gone. Now, if there are no lyrics within Shazam, there is no lyrics button, period. Also when you press the (very small, difficult to use while driving) lyrics button at the top of the page, it brings up the current line of the lyrics--but it's static, it does not advance--you have to click it again in order to see the rest of the lyrics. This is an unnecessary and redundant click and annoying. Finally, the default action of the lyrics is to enlarge and highlight the current line. This is very annoying if that's not what you want, sometimes I want to read ahead in the lyrics or scroll through the lyrics without constantly having Shazam take control back away from me and highlighting the current line.  All in all, the old lyrics system was much better, and finding lyrics so I can understand the song I'm hearing on the radio is the only reason I use Shazam. So this update is really annoying and a giant step backward as far as I'm concerned.
